post_a.text:
THE ABSOLUTE BASICS OF WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW ABOUT# BITCOIN WITHOUT KNOWING ANYTHING ABOUT TECHNOLOGY. Too many people act like "tech snobs" when talking about Bitcoin. I honestly hate talking about this topic. Because the key to success is what I always say: Physical Emotional Creative Spiritual Health. I only know that because when I've been on the floor and in pain (bad business, bad breakup, bad breath, bad everything), these four things have been the only thing that have helped. When at bottom, all of this is BS: Not knowing what stock to pick. Or what "crypto" to pick. Or what conversation topic would be hot at a cocktail party. Or even having money in the bank. Nothing would help except those four areas of health. That saved my life. One day, one week without all four being checked off each day, and my life slips. I don't want my life to slip. I want it to compound every. Please let me stay disciplined and be good and be helpful. BUT...so many people asking me now about Bitcoin. So many scams out there. So many people proud of their "tech jargon" that actually know nothing about Bitcoin or why it's important. Just read this. Then do what you want. This is an answer I made on Quora. It's all you need to know.

"Ethics is knowing the difference between what you have a right to do and what is right to do." - Potter Stewart When you face an ethical dilemma, what should you choose? What guides your compass? Who do you go to for advice? Whose life offers the values and footsteps to follow? For me, I try to pause and weigh what is right in the short term and what is right in the long-term and choose the long term path despite the short term setbacks. Empathy guides my moral compass. The values that guide me comes from the example of my father's life and also, the reflections from reading many biographies. Generally, I listen to my heart the most to guide me.

post_a.text:
Earlier this week, a friend messaged me to let me know I had made a word choice mistake in my latest  Forbes  article. (Apparently, I had typed “plaque” when I meant to type “plague.”)   My reaction? Gratitude. I want every piece of  #content  I create and share to be of the highest quality, so I appreciated my friend letting me know of my oversight.   Contrast that with an experience I had yesterday on Twitter, where someone publicly called out a different error in the same Forbes piece.    What was interesting was how he critiqued me, proclaiming in a comment—with a screenshot—that my mistake was so egregious that he “stopped reading this at this sentence” and that he couldn’t “take an article like this seriously, when attention [was] not given to it at the time of writing and production.”   My sin? I used the word “is” instead of “if.”   Despite feeling angry and embarrassed by what seemed to be an over-the-top reaction, I thanked him for giving me the heads up.   Listen, I know I’m not perfect.   I know trolls will always exist.   But I also know that each of us has a choice in how we communicate on  #socialmedia  and elsewhere.   A gentle reminder to praise in public; critique in private.   #communication 
 
 
 …see more

post_b.text:
I came into the workplace during the last financial crisis.  2020 feels familiar.  It’s ambiguous, chaotic, and uncertain.  (Man, this dramatic line spacing really does set the mood.) You could be a new grad, in between jobs, or trying to keep the wheels turning.  Either way, your  #CareerChallenges  are likely rooted in the same thing: uncertainty.  So, what happens when we find ourselves in a place that we've never been before?  It’s easy to wallow in the uncertainty, but that's not productive. Here’s my take.  This is for anyone facing a new challenge right now or feeling stuck:  Trust the goo! You have what you need within this state of ~meh~ to get through this, and even to transform. You know more than you think.  You are more capable than you feel right now.   PS: No I’m not selling a course. I use this dumb butterfly metaphor with all my friends who ask me for (questionable) life advice.  PPS: If you need questionable life advice, call me. PPPS: Yes that’s a disco ball planter. Yes, I’ll make you one.  Check the  #CareerChallenges  hashtag for more stories, and good luck! Trust the goo!

post_b.text:
Thanks to the US Consulate General in Japan, I played sensai (teacher) today at Osaka Jogakuin University today to a packed classroom of 80+ female university students! OJ is an all-female junior & senior high school + university + graduates school, established since 1884. It was rebuilt after being completely destroyed during World War II, and is now developing women talents fluent in English and business. Because SoGal was founded as a student organisation during my grad school days, I always enjoy going to campuses and interacting with next gen women. What I told the students today was: 1) women’s no.1 mistake is to underestimate ourselves. 2) Find your inner voice and let it be heard, whether it’s in politics, business or your family. 3) gender investing gap needs to be filled by young women who are savvy enough to save and invest, because consumerism and capitalism only make the rich even richer. I’d love to see a SoGal Osaka chapter being established by one of these women soon!!  #SoGalBoss   #femalefounders   #womenempowerment

post_b.text:
Decency.  Kindness.  Honesty.  Truth.   Where have these values gone?  Consider mean tweets from our President. Poor role modeling.  Patriot’s cheating again and professing lack of intent.  Poor role modeling.  Again.  A Florida Republican representative arrested for DUI denigrates Hunter Biden for addiction.  Pot calling the kettle.... And poor role modeling.  Golfer Patrick Reed not admitting his own rule breaking.  Poor role modeling.  And don’t get me started on the Astros.   Instead of Melania Trump’s “Be best” — which isn’t proper English — what about “Be decent and be honest?”.  That’s a motto worth fighting for and adopting in words and deeds.  Would that people in power and the public eye stepped up to speak and act decently and truthfully.    And I recently have focused on why it is so hard to speak up and out.  Why is it so hard to ask people to be better?  Complex to do, especially when swimming upstream against a culture that seems to tolerate bad acts. But, enough already.   I just spoke up in no uncertain terms to a person I dated in my youth (initials BC) who back then crossed clearly set sexual boundaries I believed in and denigrated me for them.  It took me 45 years. But there’s a lesson there that applies to the above observations: better late than never.

There are 2 types of LinkedIn peeps GROUP 1: They know it’s important to leverage LinkedIn as a tool.  They mostly consume content.  They understand the importance of creating content to generate visibility and authority.  But have no idea where to start nor how to create engaging content.  The often ask questions like “how do I get more views on my posts?” -  GROUP 2: These content creators are building visibility and getting business.  LinkedIn for them is a tool to: 🍗 reinforce their expertise  🍗 pull and attract clients  🍗 build a distribution channel  🍗 develop and promote their brand  They ask question like “who is my target audience and how do I attract them with my content?”  As someone who’s in “group 2” a lot of doors and opportunities have opened up for me.  From brand deals  To getting investment  To recruiting talent  To building deals with companies  If I can I do it. You can too.  #stringtheory  on  #personalbranding   #linkedinmarketing

post_a.text:
This is pretty impressive. MrBeast ( Jimmy Donaldson ), a YouTube star with nearly 50 million highly engaged followers, just launched a burger restaurant with over 300 locations across the United States…without signing a single lease. He did this by partnering with  Virtual Dining Concepts . Basically using "ghost kitchens" to provide all of the operations. It started with a single physical MrBeast Burger pop-up burger joint that gave away free food and cash. Some even got free iPads. Needless to say, it got covered.  Soon after he made the announcement that you could order his food in over 300 locations via delivery apps like  Uber  Eats or  Postmates Inc.  And for every burger purchased, money will be donated to help feed hungry families.  A social media influencer has created an instant virtual fast-food restaurant chain with low overhead costs, a built-in audience, AND has built giving back to the community into the model. Think about that the next time you hear someone disparaging "influencers" as a group. Yes, many just pose awkwardly with stuff but there are some amazing possibilities once they apply their creativity beyond social media. #influencers   #ghostkitchens   #restaurants   #restaurantbusiness   #fastfood   #mcdonalds   #burgerking   #socialmediainfluencer

post_a.text:
Steve Jobs is best known for conducting one of the most stunning business turnarounds in history: leading Apple from the brink of bankruptcy to become the most valuable company in the world.  But many who worked with the famous founder had a love/hate relationship with their boss. Yes, he was inspiring and innovative. But he could also be overbearing, impatient, arrogant. In fact, it was those latter traits that led to Jobs infamously leaving Apple back in 1985, as Jobs and Apple's board simply couldn't see eye to eye. In the eyes of many, Jobs was a "brilliant jerk." So why is it, you may ask, that in a world that seems to increasingly value collaboration and soft skills like emotional intelligence, do brilliant jerks continue to succeed? The answer's not as simple as you think. (Read more in today's column.) #apple   #emotionalintelligence   #SteveJobs   #management   #leadership   #brilliantjerks   #eqapplied   #MakeEmotionsWorkForYouNotAgainstYou

Social traffic is hyper engagement that allows you to grow: 💰 a rapid following 💰 your sales  💰 leads  Still, with all the social traffic, how do you control them? In this newsletter-article,  #stringtheory , I share my thoughts and tactics on how to boost social traffic and convert better using Linktree. One particular hack I share is leveraging "Featured" section.  A call-to-action happens inside this section. what kind of CTA button do you want on your profile. You can put your Linktree link, your home link on your LinkedIn profile. That's what I did. Check out String Nguyen. The smart content creators will turn their profiles into a landing page. A landing page only cares about conversion.  They leave one or two big buttons to control their social traffic. This article in the Wall Street Journal by former LinkedIn editor  Chip Cutter  shows the mindset and behavioral shifts that are likely to have a lasting impact on corporate travel. So what can I do? I spend a great deal of time trying to educate and not be offended by people who think that I'm less capable of accomplishing what we're doing because of the color of my skin." post_b.text:
Last week, a Southwest Airlines got delayed. Passengers sat at the gate for an hour. Two hours. Frustration set in. My friend and fellow columnist  Jeff Haden  explains what happened next: But then a gate agent stepped in and started playing games with the waiting passengers. One game? A contest for the worst driver's license picture. Other games included a paper airplane contest. The winners received Southwest gear and $25 vouchers. But the prizes weren't the point.  "I was really irritated that the flight kept getting delayed because I was going for a quick weekend trip to D.C. to visit friends," Dundas said. "Once he started playing games, I was laughing and having a great time and didn't even mind that the flight was delayed." Another example of emotional intelligence in the real world. #leadership   #management   #BestAdvice   #BusinessIntelligence   #careers   #Southwest   #EmotionalIntelligence   #EQApplied   #MakeEmotionsWorkForYouNotAgainstYou 
 
 
 …see more

Listen. We only have one more chance to get the economy working again.  The last stimulus package and the one being proposed right now both seem to have decent intentions but both are missing the target. And they are missing it for stupid, partisan reasons.  Here is the issue: This quarter, the economy will spend about $2-3 TRILLION less than was expected. GDP is normally about $5 trillion a quarter and will be about $2 trillion less this quarter (because of little to no consumer spending and all the ways that effects other businesses).  Normally, that would be the WORST RECESSION IN HISTORY, as the headlines might say, or it might even be a Depression. But "this time it's different" is finally true because this is the first time in history the government has ordered us to stay at home and not work.  This is not about whether or not that was right or wrong. . . #economy   #stimuluscheck   #stimuluspackage   #markets   #lifestyle   #writing

post_a.text:
In a world where external demands and a cacophony of noise bombard us, taking the time to turn inward and think deeply may be the ultimate luxury—and the best way to figure out what’s next in your  #career .   Here’s how:   Be intentional with your time Treat reflection as essential to your  #careerdevelopment  by scheduling time to think.   Slow down & stop multitasking It’s impossible to think deeply and carefully about your future while you’re multitasking. Slow down to find clarity among your chaos.   Eliminate distractions Up your odds for reflection success by turning off notifications, silencing your phone, and closing down tabs.   Get up & out(side) Research says walks in nature enhance brain function, reduce stress, keep you energized, and improve creativity, which enables better reflection.   Allow your mind to wander During reflection, try not to limit yourself to predetermined topics, or impose any rigid standards.   Pay attention to what bubbles up Use your self-awareness to pay attention to how you’re feeling, your reactions, and any new ideas that arise during reflection.   Record & review your thoughts so you can take action Until you capture your thoughts and goals, you’ll never be able to devise a plan of action to achieve them.   #leadership

post_b.text:
Recently watched  Kim Malone Scott 's talk about radical candor and feedback. I'm a huge advocate of giving and receiving feedback even if it is a hard thing to do, so Kim's talk stood out to me. In her book and talk, she talked about following framework (photo). The vertical axis is "Care Personally" or how Kim called it: "giving a damn axis." The horizontal axis is "Challenge Directly" or: "willing to piss people off."  The ideal quadrant to be in is radical candor where people around you, including your manager, are willing to communicate feedback directly to you because they care. The second best is obnoxious aggression, where you still get feedback, but the person giving it might not necessarily care much about you. The other two quadrants are less ideal since you won't be getting any feedback regardless if the other party cares or doesn't care about you.  What are your thoughts about giving feedback? And how do you like to give or receive feedback? Comment below.

post_b.text:
You have three life domains: Work, Relationships, and You.  At the center of these domains is you.  You require maintenance and care, which takes time.  After all, who’s more critical to helping you live the kind of life you want than you? Exercise, sleep, healthy meals, and time spent reading or listening to an audiobook are all ways to invest in ourselves.  Taking care of yourself is at the core of the three domains because the other two depend on your health and wellness.  If you’re not taking care of yourself, your relationships suffer. Likewise, your work isn’t its best when you haven’t given yourself the time you need to stay physically and psychologically healthy. At a basic physiological level, we need time in our schedules for sleep, hygiene, movement, and proper nourishment.  You also need time for psychological or spiritual fulfillment like prayer or meditation, intellectual enrichment like reading a book or taking an online course, and time for fun activities like playing video games or painting. By setting aside time to live out your values in the “You” domain, you will be able to actualize the qualities of the person you want to be. What are some of the ways you’ve taken care of yourself recently? #Indistractable   #Health   #SelfCare   #Reflection

post_b.text:
It was a late night in September, 9:44 pm, to be exact. At a very small airport, in a German city most have never heard of, Volkswagen CEO Herbert Diess patiently waited for the arrival of a special guest: Tesla CEO Elon Musk. Musk had arrived to Germany a few days earlier to visit the construction site of Tesla's new Gigafactory in Berlin, followed by meetings with German politicians and work on another Tesla-related project. But before heading home, Musk made time to take Volkswagen's new entry into the electric vehicle space, the VW ID.3, out for a spin. "You know, this is a mainstream car," Diess reminded Musk. "Not a race machine." Musk chuckled, undeterred. On the surface, it was a chummy meeting between friendly rivals. A chance for one CEO to show off his company's newest product, and the other to check out the competition. Or was it? (Read more in today's column.) #ElonMusk   #emotionalintelligence   #tesla   #volkswagen   #VW   #management   #leadership   #eqapplied #MakeEmotionsWorkForYouNotAgainstYou

Would like your feedback on business models.... I spent most of my career in investment research. The options of business models were -  1) consulting/subscription (user pays) 2) sponsorships/advertising (product provider pays) 3) transactions/brokerage (user pays on transactions) 4) ad valorem fees embedded in product (user pays % fee) As I moved to education and media (and isn't research, education and media on the same continuum of content anyway?), it seems I only have the first two options. The book 'The Content Trap' was educational on how some media properties are able to charge subscription while most struggle.  Does anyone have any other ideas on how I can make independent educational content available to those who want it? If it helps, think of leading media houses...are they in the news business or advertising business? If they were to switch to paid subscriptions, would you pay? Do you understand difference between a platform and content provider? Thanks

post_b.text:
Emotions have tremendous impact on our behavior. That’s why self-management, the ability to manage our feelings and control our reactions, is so important. If you’re better able to control your impulses, you can bring your actions into greater harmony with your values. This helps you develop qualities like determination and endurance, which will increase your effectiveness in reaching goals. And self-management isn’t only about preventing regrettable action; it also means finding a way to spur or motivate yourself to step up and take action when doing so isn’t easy. Since most of the emotions you experience occur almost instinctively, you can’t control how you feel in any given moment. But you can control how you react to those feelings—by focusing on your thoughts.  And how do you do that?  I'll be sharing a number of strategies over the next few weeks. So be sure to click on my profile and hit the follow button, or... You can read more today in chapter 2 of my new book, "EQ Applied: The Real-World Guide to Emotional Intelligence":  https://amzn.to/2sxFLho #EmotionalIntelligence #leadership #management  #BestAdvice #careers #BusinessIntelligence #communication  #relationships #PersonalDevelopment #EQApplied  #MakeEmotionsWorkForYouNotAgainstYou

Let’s talk about it! I haven’t always been the biggest Kanye fan, and I’ll be the first to admit I don’t always agree with his political opinions. BUT! The way America has crucified this man as he’s attempted to turn his life around baffles me. I had a chance to attend Sunday Service, and I’ve never felt so loved and so accepted. The message of his new album? Love yourself. Love others. Stand up for what you believe in. And be the best version of yourself, unapologetically. How can I be mad at that? As someone who identifies as Christian, I’ve struggled to reconcile my faith with the judgmental, unforgiving and often downright hypocritical attitudes we often have towards others. I’m not perfect. If all of you knew my story and my past, you might cancel me too. No matter what mistakes we’ve made, or what terrible things we’ve said and done, we’re all God’s children. We’re not defined by our past, or our mistakes. That’s what  #grace  is! Newsflash: Reconciliation requires a willingness to reconcile, and cancel culture leaves no room for growth, change or humanity. Check out my latest article in @thoughtcatalog!

My week in New York City yielded some powerful lessons as I navigated through  United Nations  General Assembly side events. The one I'll remember most: Always, ALWAYS be ready to  #network . Always have your business cards handy in those settings. Always have something to say. Always be alert and interested. That’s why I was able to have a brief chat with  Toyin Saraki , the Nigerian philanthropist who’s Founder and President of  The Wellbeing Foundation Africa . I’ve followed her on  LinkedIn  for quite some time, and it was such an incredible opportunity to meet her in person. But I also earned a PhD in "Carpe Diem" by watching  Andre Chow  seize the opportunity to network with  World Health Organization  Director General Dr. Tedros Ghebreyesus. Chow, the co-founder and Chief Product Officer of the UK-based  THE DIGITAL SURGERY LIMITED  company, had his tablet fired up and ready to display the latest  #AI  offering from Digital Surgery to a visibly impressed Dr. Tedros. I don't often quote rappers in my social media posts, but when I do, you better listen:  "You only get one shot, do not miss your chance to blow." Like Eminem says, Stay ready. When Opportunity knocks, you better never let it go. #networking   #opportunityrecognition   #seizethemoment   #goforit

We love small, easy wins. Email is the epitome of that. According to a study conducted by Professor Teresa Amibile from Harvard Business School, people love making progress. Have you ever wondered why we love making to-do lists? It’s because we love checking items off that list. When we feel like we’re making progress, we get motivated. It’s what moves us forward toward reaching a particular goal. All of this translates to how we handle our emails. Managing our inboxes makes us feel accomplished. Every time you respond to a message or get a response back from someone else, you’re moving one step forward. We feel good because it proves that we’ve gotten something done. Churchill was a great wartime leader. Different situations call for different  #leadership  skills. The current economic crisis will be significant for many of us. What can leaders do? 1. Communicate, Communicate, Communicate- Be transparent, say it as you see it. It is the only way to get trust and respect.  2. Plan, Plan, Plan- Anticipate issues, create scenarios and have SOP around this.  3. Ownership, Ownership, Ownership- Outline 3-5-7 action plans with clearly defined responsibilities for each one?  4. Visualise, Visualise, Visualise- Imagine the future when all this is behind us. What is it going to look like for everyone.  5. Commit, Commit, Commit - You are asking a lot from people. Give your personal commitment and show that you care and you will stand by them.

I was 22 when I posted my first video on LinkedIn. I'm now 26. 🤯 I have grey hair too... so time flies 😂. In all seriousness though, before I really got started I walked up to someone that was partly responsible for all of the attention LinkedIn was getting: Josh Fechter. I told him that I looked up to him and wanted to do something similar.  The first thing he told me was, "unfollow me." And that's stuck with me. Here's why: ✅ You will never lead if you only follow. You will never innovate if you only imitate. And that goes for everything – content, speaking, business, etc. ✅ You can (and totally should support people). Josh wasn't telling me to unfollow everyone. He was telling me to tune out the noise and find my own voice.  ✅ I was never going to beat Josh, at being Josh. Just like you won't beat me at being me... and no one else will beat you at being you. "It's good to be better, but it's better to be different." – Sally Hogshead.  If you want to be great... be different. Create color television when everyone is still watching in black & white. #justQ  🖖🏾🖤

A first-generation immigrant, Chicago business owner with two incredible daughters and an ambitious wife by his side was taken from us by blood cancer. That man was family. We enjoyed cigars poolside in Mexico and many drinks as we celebrated his daughter's marriage to my big brother. We laughed endlessly, regardless of translation barriers. We understood CHEERS and TEQUILLA and that was enough! We danced like party animals over lobster dinners and love. A baby in Madison, Wisconsin was diagnosed, learning her first words and taking her first steps in our hospital, attached to machines as her mother resigned from work to care for her unexpected health challenges fulltime 💔 Then we found out Grandma Soumis has blood cancer after 90 years in the Upper Peninsula of MI supporting her husband working in the mines while raising three boys and managing a family auto-repair business... The thing is, cancer doesn't discriminate.  It doesn't care if you own a business. It doesn't care if you have a family. It doesn't care if you are 5 months, 50, or 90 years old. post_a.text:
As remote work continues to skyrocket due to the Covid-19 pandemic, more and more companies are turning to employee tracking software in an attempt to measure employee productivity. And they're killing morale in the process. Just check out this CEO's description of what his company's software does: "We use AI tools to massage [multiple data points] into a real-time score that you see as does your boss and the CEO and the VP of Sales and the chief revenue officer...Your score yesterday was 74. Your colleagues were 90. They've done more." Yikes. Basically, this philosophy: -Reduces people to a single number -Reaches that number based, not on results , but on how much time you spend opening software and clicking buttons on a computer -Encourages employees to compare their value with their peers--based on how much time they've spent clicking buttons -Is predicated on the belief that employees will be motivated by fear There's a better way. (Read more in today's column.) #EmotionalIntelligence   #remotework   #workfromhome   #technology   #technologynews   #employeetracking #management   #leadership   #eqapplied   #MakeEmotionsWorkForYouNotAgainstYou

Want a better chance at that job you want to get hired for? ‘Translate’ your CV to the language the company is using. Focus on 2 elements in your CV: Title - make sure your title fits the job description. If the job description lists ‘software engineer’, don’t use ‘Backend engineer’ in your CV. If there’s a way to get a perfect match, use it. Keywords - read the full job description. Find what matters in that job. And put as many keywords as possible in your CV.  Pro tip - So many companies are using bots to screen CV. So use the EXACT same words. Use spaces before and after. Don’t let the bots rule you out.  Whatever you do, DO NOT LIE. Especially in the skill section, you will be easily spotted during the interview phase. Once you get caught lying, there’s no turning back.  Does it take time to match your CV with different positions? Yes, it does.  Getting hired is a full-time job.  #people   #hr   #skills

post_b.text:
I read a beautiful story yesterday & wanted to share. Once Krishna & Balram were walking through a dense forest. It was scary, full of fierce animals & demons. Suddenly a demon came before them. Balram was petrified & asked fearfully, "Who are you?" The demon answered, "I am a demon the size of your  #fear ". Hearing this Balram was even more scared & the demon grew bigger. The bigger he grew the more scared Balram was. Seeing him grow Balram fainted. Then demon turned his attention to Krishna. He said, "I am demon the size of your fear." Krishna looked at him nonchalantly & started playing his flute. The demon grew smaller & smaller till he disappeared. When Balram got up, he realised his  #mistake .   We live in scary times today & need to let our  #faith  win over fears. Let's make a conscious effort to have our faith in good things in life.   1) Meditate & keep calm - Your positive energies can make your immunity higher   2) Relax - Listen to music, dance or do what makes you happy   3) Hear, say & listen to good things.    4) Spend time with people who uplift you instead of those who bring you down   5) Stay safe but be kind & loving too. People need healing & love in such times    Lets remember that faith conquers fear anytime. The world is too small for anything but brotherhood.

post_b.text:
Here are five reasons why saying yes is one of the best decisions you can make for your career: 1. It opens you up to new challenges and opportunities. If you wait until you feel ready to pursue an opportunity, chances are it’ll pass you by. Saying yes means that you’re open to moving past your comfort zone and embracing a new challenge.  2. It invites collaboration. There’s a reason improvisation is rooted in the phrase, “Yes, and...” Unlike no, which shuts down conversations and progress, saying yes opens up positive possibilities and invites others to build together, fostering collaboration, partnership, and further discussion. 3. It empowers and affirms others. As a leader, choosing to say yes acts as an affirmation to others and their ideas: I hear what you just said. You’re paying attention, and they matter. And giving the green light signals trust, which empowers others. 4. It creates an environment where it’s safe to try, fail, learn, and innovate. When you freely say yes, you create a risk-tolerant environment. You encourage innovation by trying new things and using the successes and failures as learning opportunities. 5. It makes life more fun. Saying yes can bring you new sources of joy and lead you on an incredible adventure. #leadership   #career   #growth

post_a.text:
When I first started writing Indistractable, I couldn't stay on task. I wasn't productive at all.  Like many people, I blamed technology for my constant distraction  But then I noticed something 🤔 Even when I got rid of the tech gadgets, other things would grab my attention. I'd reorganize my desk, do chores around the house, or read books I never quite finished. I'd do just about anything but write my book.  Now here was the turning point in my journey 👇 I dove deeper. I began to ask myself why I was constantly shifting my attention. Then I realized something.  Most of the time, the cause of distraction isn’t what’s happening outside of us. It's about what's happening on the inside. Distraction and procrastination aren’t character flaws. They also aren’t caused by some evil plot by tech companies. They are caused by our inability to deal with uncomfortable sensations like boredom, stress, and anxiety. To use our time effectively, it's not enough to only look at external triggers like our mobile devices, we have to learn to address those underlying emotions.  How do you deal with uncomfortable feelings? Do you escape them with distraction? #Indistractable   #Procrastination   #Productivity

post_a.text:
Self-awareness isn't just about knowing how you move through the world; it’s about knowing how your energy affects others.   Everything is connected—your interactions with other people, how they perceive you, your attitude, and your responses to them in the moment—and all can be enhanced through better self-awareness.   Here’s how to become more selfless with your self-awareness:   Don’t assume that you know how others perceive you. What we think we’re projecting and how others are receiving our energy can be two very different things. To bridge the gap, seek the input of others.   Press the pause button. Our never-ending activity often leaves us feeling stressed, and we can’t help but bring that negativity with us in our interactions with others. But by regularly hitting the proverbial pause button, you’ll allow yourself a few moments to reset.   Be intentional. Before you head into a team huddle, begin a pitch, or meet with a client, make a conscious choice about what energy you want to project and then do that.   Hone your powers of observation. How aware of you of others and your environment? The best way to increase your powers of observation is to pay attention. (And spoiler alert, you can’t effectively do that when you’re multi-tasking.)   #leadership

post_b.text:
Traditionally, it’s been the CDC’s role to give the public and local officials guidance and science-based information during public health crises. During this one, however, the CDC has been sidelined.  But worry not! The CDC—which, let’s remember, stands for Centers for Disease Control!—actually has a detailed plan for reopening all aspects of businesses and social services!  And yet....The Trump administration shelved this very document created by our nation’s top disease investigators.  Let me ask, ‘When you get sick, do you call your doctor’s office for medical care, or do you call your politician for medical care?’ Why on earth would we care what a political organization has to say about a pandemic? There used to be a joke among those of us in medicine.  We would say that doctors always thought they were qualified do other—unrelated—jobs, like run hospitals even though they didn’t know how to open an excel file.  Trust me when I say that anytime someone extends themselves outside of their training and experience, it never works out optimally. My advice—as a trusted healthcare profession—is this:Find the CDC guidelines for reopening, print it or save it, and use it...and use only it to guide your every move.

Despite all the madness in the world, COVID-19 crisis could potentially have some positive outcomes: 1) Many schools, particularly K-12, which haven't had online contents are rushing to create digital materials for students. That will help make a leap on e-learning across all stages of education system. 2) Many other small businesses particularly the brick & mortars (e.g. ballet or piano classes) which lost their footprints are becoming more creative, creating and distributing their contents online which could unlock new business opportunities for them. 3) Organizations in totally different disciplines are coming together in new ways to cope with the coronavirus: Zoom offers K-12 students access to its videoconferencing software for free. The Gates Foundation, Wellcome & Mastercard are committing $125M in funding to companies developing treatments for the coronavirus.  4) Many companies that haven't been fully prepared to support  #WorkFromHome  needed to move to that direction. 5) Despite "social distancing," the deep human connections will get stronger & our communities will hopefully continue get tighter. China sent medical aid to Italy & Spain. Many offer help to their neighbors on Nextdoor. #positivethinking   #beingoptimistic   #elearning   #coronavirus   #covid19   #socialdistancing

post_a.text:
Women-to-Women: Life (and Career) Advice. My mom recently passed and I found a card from her which, honestly, I don't recall receiving...but reading it again, I think it is full of wisdom. Here it is: If I were your age again, I'd spend a lot less time examining what's wrong about me, and a lot more time enjoying what's right about me. Because you know what? You're already perfect enough. So, live life on your own terms. Be who you are and love what you love. Reserve the right to be wrong. If things take an occasional turn you hadn't planned on, don't be tempted to call it a mistake. Just call it life and tuck the experience in your back pocket for safe keeping. Pretty soon you can take it out, share it with someone else, and call it wisdom. I'm not kidding. That's how it works. So, hey--enjoy the life you're in. Be as happy as you can. And feel how deeply and completely you are loved....

Though American women were "officially" granted the right vote through ratification of the 19th Amendment in August 1920, it took a quite a while longer for Black American women to fully enjoy that freedom. Some say we're still battling, thanks to voter suppression and other tactics aimed at silencing people of color. But this year, Black America must pay tribute to people like the late Emma Sanders, who squared off against some of the most vicious racists America ever produced in Mississippi to ensure that her own party did not discriminate against Black people. I know the path in my journey is paved by the sacrifices of men and women like Sanders. I'm determined her efforts won't be in vain this November.

Have I assumed that they understand the terms I am using, that they have the skills and knowledge needed or the time, tools, and other resources required?” Check your assumptions. Technology is wonderful and it can transform our lives for the better ...as long as we use it on our own terms.  Websites like Facebook, YouTube, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Instagram can help us keep in touch with our families, reconnect with old friends, and stay up-to-date on current events.  Tech can, and often does, add real value to our lives.  The danger they pose is when we begin to use these tools on other peoples’ terms -- when we get sucked into the infinite scroll or autoplay.  I recently spoke with  Tony Whatley  on the  365 Driven  podcast where we spoke about how to get the best of technology without letting it get the best of us. Do you know what soft skill leaders practice to bridge gaps and encourage open dialogue and collaboration?   KINDNESS. Here are three ways you can immediately incorporate kindness into your professional world: 1. Realize that kindness does not equal weakness. The finest leaders I know embrace kindness as a strength. They set a positive tone and create a culture that's more welcoming and tolerant. 2. Incorporate a "Kindness First" practice. Each day in your To-Do list, before you do anything else, take at least one action that has no other purpose than to be kind to another person. 3. Stand out for the positive in a proactive and vocal way. As a business leader, you have an opportunity to use kindness to share your core beliefs and insights through your social media posts, your company's values statement, and in the way in which you tell your own story. When you do so, you unite and inspire people and keep them focused on the positive. #kindness   #leadership   #business   #success   #professionaldevelopment   #relationships   #communication   #growth   #softskills   #career   #HumansFirst

In late 2019, I started working with  Global Press Journal  reporter  Noella Nbihogo  on her story about the  #indigenous  Pygmy people living on Idjwi Island, located in Lake Kivu near the Democratic Republic of Congo. Noella's story highlighted the discrimination and gross inequity that Pygmies endured. In late 2020, through my role as a communications consultant with the  Emerson Collective , I have the privilege of supporting Dr.  Jacques Sebisaho, MD, MPA , who was born on Idjwi Island and who established the  Amani Global Works  network of health care facilities that was originally created to address the healthcare access challenges for the Pygmy people. By helping Jacques strengthen his brand and amplify his mission of  #healthequity , I have come full circle as an  #AfricanAmerican  journalist who keeps  #Africa  at the center of my heart. Let Jacques himself tell you more about his project, in this presentation at  The Aspen Institute 's 2014 Ideas Health festival. #globalhealth   #globaldevelopment   #DialFellows   #EmersonCollective   #HealthForAll   #indigenouspeoples   #indigenoushealth   #healthcareaccess

HOW WILL THIS END? AND WHAT HAPPENS NEXT?  The stock market was up huge today. I don't like it. I want the market to go up. I'm absolutely sure that there is a greater than 95% chance that the markets will be SIGNIFICANTLY higher in the near future. But as I wrote last week (when the market was higher than it is now), I DO NOT BUY when markets go UP OR DOWN 10% in a day. That's too insane. It means there is too much uncertainty. It means amateurs are getting in the game (or billionaires, who can afford more risk). The market is a barometer of uncertainty.  But this is what I think will happen. And this is what I would do, given the data we now have.

post_b.text:
Serving Our Country or Serving Private Company Profits? Veterans who serve on behalf of America, get injured on behalf of America and then whose recovery and rehabilitation is calculated by Stockholders profits when they return home? The issue is about privatization of the VA. And two things are known when comparing private to government/public health systems: 1) both have equal quality and 2) access to Care varied radically because of the different business models: For-profits are most likely to offer relatively profitable medical services; government hospitals are most likely to offer relatively unprofitable services; nonprofits often fall in the middle. For-profits are also more responsive to changes in service profitability than the other two types. This will really test our attitude about “People Over Profit.”

Everyone is in their own fight club, but we don't talk about it... Because it's fight club! 💪 When I'm overwhelmed, I lean into a support system of badasses I have built since my health and career journeys collided. No, I'm not a health coach or fitness instructor and you'll never find me at a gym (introverts unite, at our homes, independently!) But health plays a serious role in my career because of incurable diseases and disability. Millions like me battle chronic illness while working full-time, running multiple businesses, and parenting - but these battles are hidden. From depression to cancer and everything in between... Please remember to be kind and supportive. And if you're struggling, Surround yourself with inspiring powerhouses that go through hell and back regularly just to get through the day! Start with the XXO community. Fuel your mindset  & build your character with the company you keep. To this day, there is NO WAY I would be where I am in my health OR career journey without the incredible people I feel blessed to call connections and friends. Thank you for being supportive and kind during these intense phases of testing character! #motivation

I went on the Talking To Teens Podcast to talk about the psychology behind distraction and how we can raise indistractable kids. (All opinions solely mine and do not reflect the views of my employer) I have largely stayed out of the COVID-19 controversy, but this issue is too important to humanity, for any of us to stay silent. I took the video below while walking through Fort Mason this weekend. Not in Missouri, or Texas, or Georgia. This was in the heart of San Francisco, California. 90+ percent of people there weren't wearing masks. Most were young. Lots wore t-shirts with names of companies most would recognize.  This, in a time when doctors, nurses and frontline workers are literally fighting for their lives so we can live ours. COVID-19 doesn't know or care about you, your social wants and needs, or your political beliefs. Just because you're young and healthy doesn't mean you can't infect someone else - quite the opposite. This asymptomatic pandemic has killed people of all ages, and continues to ravage the world. So stop the posturing and the bravado. Please. Stop being cavalier and careless. We haven't won the fight. Wear a mask. Observe social distancing. Wash your hands often.  Listen. To. The. Science. Your actions could literally either save or take a life, yours or that of others.  #covid19   #socialdistancing   #dobetter Please share. Stay healthy, stay safe. https://lnkd.in/gC9h-9e

post_b.text:
Here are 6 questions to help you achieve behavioral change (after you say or do something you later regret): 1. Why did I react the way I did?  2. Did my reaction help me or harm me?  3. How does this situation fit into the big picture? That is, how will I feel about it in hour? A week? A year?  4. What may I have misunderstood or be getting wrong, especially in the heat of the moment? 5. What would I change if I could do it again? 6. What could I say to myself next time that would help me think more clearly? There's no microwave method to success. The key is not to skip through these questions quickly, rather, to take your time, ponder, and develop an action plan. Read more in my new book, "EQ Applied: The Real-World Guide to Emotional Intelligence":  https://amzn.to/2sxFLho

The fastest way to build your personal brand on LinkedIn. Don't copy someone else. Create original content.  Content that is: 🍗 engaging 🍗 has a strong human element 🍗 reinforces your expertise/cred Even posting once a week will put you on top of mind. Still, with LinkedIn's algo - they send the extra juices to a channel with engagement + regular channels.  But to be a channel, publish daily content posting is required. Be you. Be human. I noticed when I was publishing on client's account that: Tactical know how's have low reach. But adding a human element makes me more relatable, and people want to see their story into the mix. Quick recap, to stand out on LinkedIn... Create content that has a super relatable element of human. You are you. Your brain is you. Your stories are you. Be a communicator that conveys your authenticity. Your superpower. And a vision for the world. #stringtheory  on  #personalbranding   #linkedinmarketing   #contentmarketing

Extreme listening are two words that don’t usually go together. But there is no other way to describe what Deeyah Kahn does. A Muslim woman, she made a documentary, White Right: Meeting the Enemy, about spending time with white supremacists. Her results were so profound, it raises the question, what if we all had the capacity for extreme listening? Check out our conversation on this week's episode of A Bit of Optimism at  apple.co/simonsinek  or wherever you like to listen to podcasts.

post_a.text:
Last week, I spoke with a recent grad who asked for advice on how to find "aha moments" in his career and life. My response was that you cannot map or prepare every step of your career to optimize for aha moments.  Instead, aha moments come, go, and may reemerge just like opportunities. Instead of anticipating for aha moments, keep a curious and open mind on opportunities that come your way. Be surrounded by peers and mentors who can help identify these moments. Aha moments will come in different shapes and sizes, but also at different times. It's so so easy to start comparing ourselves to others then try to expedite our own timeline. While some competition is healthy and we should always act with a sense of urgency, never feel that need to fit and adhere yourselves to someone else's timeline.  Thought this infographic did a great job illustrating that we all experience aha moments differently. cc:   Anna Vital

"I don't want to come across too salesy". Do you know what's worse - being awks about how awesome you are When you're on social media, you're essentially selling your authority, influence, and expertise.  It's a limitation that we set for ourselves. I became more confident in selling when I started hanging with  Justin Michael  and  The Salesborgs™  community.  I'm a good marketer. I became a better sales person. haha Fundamentally, marketing sells the hype and trust.  Selling is presenting the solution to your problem - a good product does sell itself.  The common thread between the two: know who your customer is.  If you don't know your ICP/Target market - it's really hard to attract their attention, and selling them anything. Instead of saying: ah I don't want to come across salesy. Rework the narrative and be confident about what you're offering. It's the difference between charging $100 p/hour to $1000 p/h (guess where I sit? :P) Be confident. Promote your work, your expertise and influence. #stringtheory  on  #personalbranding and if you want to become a better seller - come hang out in The Salesborgs - it's $1 entry fee but as utility-based community - we share insights on outreach, cold calls. post_a.text:
5 mistakes while  #Fundraising  : 1. Playing the bluff: "I already have a term sheet. I need an answer immediately". Too often the deadline is artificial & unrealistic, compromising the founder's credibility. It leaves no room for an authentic engagement for a meaningful outcome.   2. Overvaluation: "I am interested only if the valuation is $100M". If you draw a hard line that is a big gap from the investor's assessment of the valuation, most often they will disengage. Also, negotiating down significantly hurts your credibility.   3. Pitch: CEOs should own & lead the conversation with the investors. Sometimes, the banker takes over while presenting, hurting the CEO's credibility. Investors like CEOs to have ownership of the numbers that they are committing.   4. Communication: Another mistake is not communicating the business proposition early in the presentation. Pace the presentation for 35 mins & communicate the uniqueness of the product that makes you win the market up front.   5. Feedback: Often, founders don't listen to feedback & get defensive to questions asked. In fact, questions are asked with an intent to understand the business better.

As a black entrepreneur, I shrugged off race for a long time. But, people like me do not have the privilege to “ignore” what is happening right now.  I have a business to run. I have bills to pay. I have responsibility to the people that follow me… but it’s impossible to think about anything else right now. If I can use even a portion of my influence to bring some change, I know that I have to. I WILL NOT ignore the state of the world.   If you have questions, ask. If you need resources, ask. If you want to help, ask. We are all in this together. Period. And if you don’t view it like that then I’m going to ask you to unfollow me.    Because I’m tired of living in a world that values assimilation over diversity. I’m tired of living in a world that kills for differences. I’m tired of living in a world that would rather take comfort in privilege and division, than be uncomfortable while progressing.    Ignoring is a privilege that I do not have (and many do not have).   I don’t have all of the answers. I don’t speak for all black/brown people. But I do hope that social can be a place in which we can discuss and grow. I will do my best to continuously show up, educate, etc. in any way that I can. #justQ  🖖🏾🖤  #BlackLivesMatter

post_b.text:
Want others to pay more attention to what you have to say? Start paying attention to them, first. In his timeless book "How to Win Friends and Influence People," Dale Carnegie wrote the following: “If you aspire to be a good conversationalist, be an attentive listener...Remember that the people you are talking to are a hundred times more interested in themselves and their wants and problems than they are in you and your problems.” Carnegie’s advice was valuable when he penned it, but it’s even more relevant today because the rise of modern technology has reduced most attention spans. Go to any restaurant, and you’ll be sure to find a few individuals who can’t resist the urge to check their phones every few minutes, often to the chagrin of their dinner partners. In contrast, when you treat your conversation partner as the most interesting person in the room—curious to hear their thoughts and opinions—you stand out as different.  Read more about emotionally intelligent influence in Ch 6 of my new book, "EQ Applied: The Real-World Guide to Emotional Intelligence":  https://amzn.to/2sxFLho   #EmotionalIntelligence   #BestAdvice   #PersonalDevelopment   #leadership   #management   #relationships   #influence   #EQ   #EQApplied   #MakeEmotionsWorkForYouNotAgainstYou

post_a.text:
Despite my "lack of perfect English" - I am where I am. My mum was an illiterate Viet-refugee. She gave birth to me in Australia. She worked hard for us 5 kids to go to school.  She says to me: "Be doctor." I didn't. Blood freaks me out. Then she says "You good with words. Go, be lawyer". Instead, I became a creator. The education I gained through school allowed me to get a degree. But the best teacher is my mum. She gave me grit and resourcefulness to never give up. I used my curiosity of knowledge to create my own path. Many will correct my English. Looking at my typos, laughing at my weird grammar and syntax. Now,  for anyone who corrects me - I thank them for being my free spellchecker. Otherwise, use  Grammarly , which is what I did with this post. Or be best mates with wordsmiths - I have second eyes like  Max ,  Jacob ,  Bobby  and  Anfernee .  For anyone who wants to create: 🍗 As long as your intention is clear. 🍗 Your messaging will resonate. 🍗 Your stories, Your experience are all yours. I am where I am because I didn't give up. Like being a  #LinkedInTopVoices  (three times in a row) Still, keep creating. Don't aim for perfection, aim for progress. It's a journey worth making. How Are You Feeling Today? According to historic research there are six basic emotions: anger, fear, surprise, disgust, happiness and sadness but  new research suggests that there are at least 27 distinct emotions—and they are intimately connected with each other. In contrast to the notion that each emotional state is an island, the study found that “there are smooth gradients of emotion between, say, awe and peacefulness, horror and sadness, and amusement and adoration. In general, people can be very bad at recognizing the emotions of themselves and others, which in turn leads to a lot of misunderstandings and missteps.  In some ways, professional and personal interactions would be a lot easier if everyone used a map like the one above to identify how they are feeling.

post_b.text:
February 2020 Budget Speech of Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has been the longest in history -- two hours and 40 minutes. How long will be this year's Budget Speech?  Incidentally, going by the word length, it hasn't been the longest. Manmohan Singh's 18,650-word 1991 Speech is the longest. Nirmala Sitharaman's 2020 Speech had 13,275 words.  Arun Jaitley's 2018 Budget Speech has been the second longest -- 18,604 words. HM Patel's 1977 Speech at the Interim Budget has been the shortest, just 800 words. Sitharaman's 2019 Budget Speech lasted for two hours and 17 minutes, just two minutes longer than Jaswant's Singh's 2003 Speech. #Budget   #finance   #India   #GDP   #FiscalDefict   #Growth   #Infrastructure   #Health   #Welfare

Surrounding ourselves with the things that lift us up helps us to spread that positivity and joy this world desperately needs. So what do you surround yourself with?! post_b.text:
I was a part-time ghost writer for two years before I launched my first company. Writing other people’s stories for a living. Pretending to be someone else forced me to get real with who I wanted to be.  For a lot of my life I felt like a ghost. Always behind the scenes. Always quiet. Always thinking. Never really excellent at anything. And not all that memorable. Something about watching people find success with the words I wrote, showed me that I was capable of so much more in my own life. Someone much smarter than me said something along the lines of “excellence can be sparked from a mental expansion of what we believe to be capable.” ✅ Seeing people that we resonate with do something similar to what we want to do. ✅ Surprising ourselves and doing something we never thought we could do.  Find people that are doing it that look like you or come from where you come from. Or go out and do it and see what happens. Ideally both. So much opportunity out there. Get after it.  #justQ  🖖🏽🖤

post_a.text:
Work has radically changed. It's time to embrace it. When you equip and empower your employees to adapt and find the tools they need to be effective and efficient it is an investment in your company’s present and future profitability.  Recently I worked with the largest independent Coca-Cola distributor in the United States. Their remote sales team worked hard, nights and weekends and rarely took time off.  However, sales call volume and sales numbers were down. Morale had plummeted. Paperwork, emails, phone calls, and unmet goals were piling up. Management realized that their team members were frantically busy, but not terrifically productive.  We worked with the sales team members, managers, and the sales leadership team and boosted productivity and performance. As a result, the remote sales team's  total sales calls per week went up over 20% from the prior year, which translated into $2 million in additional revenue.  Embrace the new world of work and make an investment in your company’s long-term growth and profitability.

post_a.text:
Today McKinsey's Private Equity Practice in Greater China published a new report: "In search of alpha: Updating the playbook for private equity in China." China is the third largest private equity market in the world: in 2019, private equity and venture capital funds deployed $66 billion of their funds in China, compared to $71 billion in the United Kingdom and $471 billion in the United States.  From 2009 through 2019, fundraising for PE firms operating in China grew at a compounded annual rate of 29 percent, the strongest growth among all major asset classes. Historically, funds have been buoyed by China’s impressive macroeconomic growth - but this now begun to steadily fall. To achieve desired returns, PE firms will have little choice but to switch their focus from ‘beta’ (performing in line with the market) to ‘alpha’ (market-beating returns). Our website features video interviews with 3 leading private equity dealmakers: KC Kung, Founder of Nexus Point; Jean Salata, Founder of Baring Private Equity Asia; and Frank Su, Head of PE Asia for CPP Investments. #China   #economy   #privateequity

There is so much untapped potential of women and minorities. Even with a $15M VC fund, 40 city chapters, 65 investments to date, 100,000+ reach of women and diverse entrepreneurs, we are far from scratching the surface. Every day, we are humbled and in awe that we can touch a someone’s life and inspire her to live beyond boundaries.  In my speech I share with people to plan lives based on death.  Elizabeth Galbut  and I ask ourselves, “If I’m in a building on fire or a plane that’s crashing, do I have regrets before I die?” Our answers have been no. post_b.text:
Here's how to make comparison work for—and not against—your career:   Reframe your envy into a learning opportunity Instead of feeling jealous of your coworker’s or competitor’s success, study their behaviors to learn what worked and what didn’t, not to replicate their path, but to advise your own.   Adopt an abundance mindset It’s possible for you and your peers to do well at the same time; it need not be an either/or situation.   Realize that “success” is a fluid, moving target Get clarity on what success looks like for you, and then focus your efforts on achieving it rather than someone else’s idea.   Don’t compare your chapter 1 with someone else’s chapter 20 You’re setting yourself up for disappointment when you compare your journey with another’s, particularly when that person is decades ahead of you in their career.   Strive for progress, not perfection The leaders you admire have succeeded despite their failures because they used them as opportunities to grow, realizing that progress beats perfection.   Track your progress  Ultimately, you’re in competition with an older version of yourself, not someone else. Make it a regular habit to track your  #progress  and celebrate how far you’ve come in growing your career.   How do you use  #comparison  to fuel your  #career ? 
 
 
 …see more

post_a.text:
A friend recently gifted me ‘The Infinite Game’ by  Simon Sinek . As I continue reading it, I thought of sharing beautiful chunks from the first few pages.  1. In the Infinite Game of  #Business , we may not know all of the other players, and new ones can join the game at any time.  2. To one company, being number one may be based on the number of customers they serve. To another, it could be about revenues, stock performance… In infinite games, there are multiple metrics, which is why we can never declare a winner.  3. The game of business has no finish line. Despite the fact that companies are playing in a game that cannot be won, too many business  #leaders  keep playing as if they can.  4. To succeed in the Infinite Game of business, we have to stop thinking about who wins or who’s the best and start thinking about building organizations that are strong enough and healthy enough to stay in the game for many generations to come.  5. The true value of an organization is measured by the desire others have to contribute to that organization’s ability to keep succeeding.  #MyBookNotes   #Entrepreneurship

Enterprises are rapidly adopting leading-edge technologies such as real-time analytics, artificial intelligence and blockchain. These powerful technologies require IT infrastructure that provides great flexibility and scalability, wide-ranging data services, seamless movement within cloud architectures, and perhaps most importantly - Speed. The Non-Volatile Memory Express (NVMe) protocol is one of the most powerful new innovations designed to accelerate data processing. IBM Storage has been rapidly moving forward with implementing NVMe-based solutions across its entire storage portfolio. The  IBM  FlashSystem family of data systems has already incorporated NVMe capabilities into its High-End Enterprise and Midrange Enterprise FlashSystem. With the introduction of the IBM FlashSystem 5100, IBM integrates the speed and efficiency of NVMe technologies into the Entry Enterprise line designed to provide affordable, highly functional, high-performance storage solutions for enterprises of all sizes. For clients using ethernet for storage networking, IBM FlashSystem 5100 supports iSCSI Extensions for RDMA (iSER), a new option to deliver high performance over lower-cost Ethernet networks. post_b.text:
Today, the number of people who follow me on  LinkedIn  passed 250,000. First, let me send mad love and honor to the African continent, where I suspect the bulk of my followers live. That’s because since I first touched down in Accra, Ghana in April of 2003, I’ve organized and/or participated in at least one journalism training workshop in 11 different African countries, and lived in two of them. Africa taught me how to be a strong leader. I learned how to be a Mama Hen there, too. I realized that the two personas can peacefully co-exist, especially when you’re nurturing young minds. To the rest of the folks around the world who clicked the little “Follow” box beside my name, you can’t begin to know what that small gesture means to me. Along my path of reinvention and renewal, I’m trying to find meaning by adding value. If you believe I’ve done that at some point, keep reading.  To LinkedIn, what began as little more than an occasional online diary for my random thoughts has morphed into one of the biggest challenges/opportunities of my professional life. If I can just keep learning, writing and communicating relevant information in interesting ways, I know my career will soar. #Africa #journalism #inspiration #career #writing

It's incredibly easy to fixate on bad news and get sucked into a negative state, but how often do we stop and appreciate the world we live in? Think about this for just a moment 👇 We live in a time where we're able to complete work, social distance, and maintain close relationships all from the comfort of our homes. Some studies have indicated that on average, we spend 5.5 hours a day just on leisure. Not to mention, we also have more choices and ways to entertain ourselves than ever. But with all of this time, connectivity, and choice, it's also become more important to outline our values.  I define values as attributes of the people we want to become -- and it's important to understand our values because only by knowing what they are do we know how to allocate our time.  To fully enjoy the benefits of modern life, we have to make good use of our time. And the only way to do that is to build our values into our schedule.  #Indistractable   #Values   #Relationships

post_b.text:
My flight experience with Condor Airlines: I arrived at Condor Airlines counter in SeaTac International Airport (booked trip through Expedia) at 4:10 PM or so for a 5:15 PM flight. They "closed early" with single employee who could do nothing and a supervisor who simply, and incredulously, refused to return to help us. (I finally got him on the phone after begging the lady that was here to call him, to just have him tell everyone he wouldn't be coming back). I called Condor Reservations, who also told me there was nothing they could do to help. Two folks trickled in after me - they're faring even worse. Unreal. I have missed flights before, for all sorts of reasons reasons. I have NEVER, however, been in a situation where an agent was not behind the desk to help me book another flight, or had a number that I could call where someone could do something. For a fee or for free.  What makes this incident so egregious, and just sickening, is that I was within bounds of my travel time, and NO ONE, absolutely NO ONE, at Condor, was here to do anything to check me in or help me. All they cared about was going home early and closing shop while leaving their customers stranded. I would appreciate you spreading this message for awareness via social media, and thank you. #CondorAirlines

post_b.text:
It's more than the classic underdog story. To watch (former) backup quarterback Nick Foles in action is to take a live class in leadership with emotional intelligence--the ability to make emotions work for you, instead of against you. For example, check out Foles's postgame interview after yesterday's playoff win. Asked what's going through his mind in these high-pressure situations, Foles said this:  "What I learned on those stages is just how to calm myself in a chaotic moment, when there's...a ton of pressure. And just really simplifying in my head. Getting in the huddle, looking at the guys that I trust. Know that it's all on the line for us and we're just going to get the job done." Foles then summed up the lesson in 6 simple words: "It's just belief in one another." Foles's comments may be inspiring, but they're also backed up by serious research. (Read more in today's column.) #EmotionalIntelligence   #leadership   #BestAdvice   #management   #culture   #PersonalDevelopment   #BusinessIntelligence   #careers   #empathy   #EQApplied   #MakeEmotionsWorkForYouNotAgainstYou

‪let’s talk monetary frameworks applied to crypto.‬ currently, cryptoc fluctuates much like fiat, freely, within a “post Bretton Woods framework”.‬ within the crypto world, Bitcoin can be viewed as having the same role as the $ in the fiat world. similarities abound! ‪stablecoins (i use term to also include digital coupons backed 1:1 by fiat), however ill designed, aspire to bring stability, very much akin to a Bretton Woods monetary framework, with rules that strive to negotiate a monetary order.  ‪a return to a negotiated order for fiat currencies should not be ruled out & indeed is a potential path forward (see trade wars), to bring stability. ‬ ‪currently the stablecoin movement is uncoordinated, similar to proto c-banks acting on their own, within walled gardens.  might we envision a crypto monetary framework where stablecoins (or what comes after the current crop) & main protocols (bitcoin, ethereum & other main crypto) where there is coordination to usher tight bands of fluctuation? - assuming a modicum of sensible regulation to fight manipulation & fraud. that might be a logical evolution & help bring the much needed stability necessary to mass institutional or retail adoption everyone desperately seeks?   #crypto   #centralbanks   #bitcoin   #ethereum   #cryptocurrencies

I’m sick and tired of listening to people BRAG about how LITTLE sleep they get each night. NO. It’s not cool operating at half efficiency or stressing your body out to the lengths of incurable disease and cancer… Everyone’s body is different – requiring different diets and hours of rest. Personally, with my neurological deterioration, if I don’t get eight hours of sleep, I get nauseous, dizzy, fatigued, clumsy, and more… It feels like a college hangover, without the fun night with friends. Tip 9 in my  #10Tips10Days  series to be a BETTER, HEALTHIER, more FULFILLED professional... is to rest up! I LOVE SLEEP! How many hours of rest does your body need to operate at full capacity? Are you making sleep a priority for your overall success? Remember, you can’t pour from an empty cup! 1️⃣ Be Present – Find your anchor to remind you. 2️⃣ Reminisce – Don’t let happy memories go to waste!  3️⃣ Acknowledge – Acknowledge the invisible.  4️⃣ Neuroplasticity – Think positive thoughts for every negative one.  5️⃣ Compliment – Give kind notes often.  6️⃣ Pause – Practice deep breathing exercises.  7️⃣ Reflect – Remember how far you’ve come. 8️⃣ Smile – It does funny things to your brain! #Leadership   #Fulfillment   #HealthandWellness   #SelfCare   #ChantelShares   #Disability   #Happiness

post_a.text:
Acceptance.  It’s what so many of us yearn for. From the playground to the workplace, we spend our whole lives trying to fit in, whether consciously or unconsciously. And it’s no wonder: we’re wired to belong. We want others to like us. Rather than risk rejection for being different, it’s safer to blend in. But in a professional sense, that can be a big mistake. When you try to be all things to all people, you end up being a non-compelling, watered-down version to everyone. Your offering becomes a commodity. But what if you stopped trying to fit in, and instead, focused on standing out?  It starts with telling your story.  But to do so, you’ll need to identify and articulate your common thread, that theme that weaves together your personal and professional experiences to tell your unique story. Do you know yours?  It’s worth considering because once you have your story, it changes everything.  When you embrace and highlight what makes you different and how your uniqueness adds value and helps people, you shine. And that light will attract others to you for all the right reasons. #branding   #personalbranding   #storytelling   #careerstory 
 
 
 …see more

post_a.text:
Some folks think  Netflix  launched streaming fully formed. The reality is that when streaming launched, nothing about it could be considered "great." The streaming quality wasn’t there and the library of titles available to watch was sub-par. Which is why it was launched as a free add-on for subscribers. Also, at-launch, you could only watch via a PC. Then, eventually a Mac. But the challenge the company faced was how to tap into the TV. Smart TVs and internet-connected DVD players were not widespread. Enter gaming consoles. Why? Because the goal was to get Netflix on as many internet-connected devices as quickly as possible. And game consoles already had installed user bases in the tens of millions and their consoles were all connected to the internet. So Netflix partnered with  Microsoft  XBOX,  Sony  PS3, and, believe it or not,  Nintendo  Wii. This was a mock-up of the sticker used on XBOX360 LIVE Gold physical packaging from 2008. Nudging patients to do things like taking medications does not work, as it turns out. So how do doctors and nurses partner with their patients to be more "compliant?" (Note: I do not care for this term since it is prerogative and connotes 'bad patient/good provider.') Why don't patients do 'what's in their best interest ?' Is it possible the down sides are not clear or are we humans only "wired" to deal with the "here and now..." come what may? Just as we are bad with dieting or exercise perhaps the same is true when it comes time to take our meds. Selected Excerpt: "A thorough review published in The New England Journal of Medicine about a decade ago estimated that up to two-thirds of medication-related hospital admissions in the United States were because of noncompliance, at a cost of about $100 billion a year. These included treatments for H.I.V., high blood pressure, mental health and childhood illnesses (it can be difficult to get children to take their medicine, too)."

Edna Adan Ismail  is a nurse, midwife, a retired  United Nations  diplomat, French Legion of Honour recipient, Former First Lady and former foreign minister of #Somaliland -- an unrecognized, self-declared state that has been going it alone since 1991.  Adan Ismail was also a founding member of the Somali Red Crescent back in 1963.  The tireless 80-year-old has poured everything she has, including her pension, into providing much-needed health care to a population with one of the highest maternal and infant mortality rates in the world -- a situation that's been exasperated by Somalia's long civil war, which led to the death or departure of nearly all of the country's health care workers.  During her TEDxRC² talk, Adan Ismail demonstrates how hospitals like hers (which she dared to build on the site of an old killing ground and graveyard) are on the pioneering edge of training local medical professionals to meet local health challenges.  #Africa #globalhealth #maternalhealth #midwifery #midwivesmatter #natgeotraveller #HealthForAll

post_a.text:
For  #FlashbackFriday , “The Week I Went Blonde,” back in May of 2007. I would be leaving my job at  NPR  the next month, to help establish a radio reporters' training facility for  Internews Network  in Gulu,  #Uganda . But before that big move, I led a week-long journalism workshop in  #AddisAbaba ,  #Ethiopia  for Internews. I met a little girl named Bini during that week, and she helped me explain to family and friends why I kept returning to the African continent. Here's part of the email I sent home: "I'm also here because of the children. I keep coming back because of girls like the one in these pictures. Bini is 2-years-old, and lives with her parents and two sisters in St. Joseph's War Memorial Cemetery. Yes, they LIVE there, in a tin-roofed shack.    "Now, both of Bini's parents are HIV positive. If they die, she and her sisters will be alone in the world. If at least one of her parents lives for more than 3 years and THEN dies, Bini and her sisters will be in worse trouble. That's because I just learned yesterday that many of the orphanages in Ethiopia will not accept children older than 5." "If I can help Ethiopian journalists tell these stories, maybe it will make a difference. It certainly makes me feel like I’ve done something really useful.”

post_b.text:
Before social media, people spent a lot of their time consuming blogs. Bloggers wrote about what they cared about. They created because they wanted to. They shared whatever they felt like. No filter.  Next came social media and then we started asking questions like: ✅ How can I hack the algorithm? ✅ How can I gain more followers? ✅ What if this post doesn't get enough likes? ✅ What if I lose followers because I talk about another passion of mine? ✅ Etc. Social media is an extension of you. Post what you want to post. Create what you want to create. It needs to start with you. I am posting this as much for me as I am for you. We get so caught up in doing things for other people. I'd love to see how unique LinkedIn would look if we all shared the things that we actually wanted to share. Just some thoughts. #justQ  🖖🏽🖤 
 
 
 …see more

post_b.text:
Spent the day at the accounting show.   It was a regular show kind of day.   Singaporeans are like most accountants here in the US.  They are behind in cloud adoption but wanting to learn and are genuine professionals.   They are warm and friendly people.  The best part of my day was hanging out with my Australian social media friends some of whom I only just met in Real Life today.  They laughed at how “American” I am in that I’ve opted for a PB&J sandwich for breakfast everyday.  The hotel breakfast buffet has some strange things on it.  So, i”m going with a known.   We also had an in-depth conversation about Jello salads.  And they have no idea that pretzel jello tastes delicious.   Or how my Mom would spend hours making 7 layer jello.   And that Finger Jello was a treat.   Finally they took the most priceless picture of me laughing at the swag of a metal straw that’s comes with its own cleaner.  I’m not seeing the connection between straws and software.   We were all pretty sober.  Social Media builds such strong relationships that going out with them was like going out with old friends.  And  Wayne Schmidt  said it best when he said we had the most progressive accountants in world together for conversation and we were talking about Jello!  #besties .   #radicalcpa   #cpa

One of the key ways for families to build intergenerational wealth is via real estate. But on top of slavery and Jim Crow, there was red-lining by banks and real estate covenants that kept African Americans from being able to tap into that.  This post by  Ben Thompson  at  Stratechery  does a solid job of knitting together how those business practices, in large part but by no means solely, created the situation America finds itself in today with regard to the systemic opression of black Americans. Keep in mind, the post only focuses on one city - Madison, Wisconsin. But it happened in every city, all across America. #race   #banking   #blacklivesmatter   #dobetter

Two pieces of free advice when using video in ads on  Facebook  and  Instagram : 1/ Add captions - This at least gives you a shot at catching people scrolling with the sound off (which is the default) and it also helps the hearing impaired who are using these visual media.  2/ Cut to the chase - Remember, when people are scrolling you have a limited window to grab their attention. So many video ads are trying to be too clever by half. Not to say don't be creative, just don't leave out key visual information in the first few seconds. These may seem like obvious tips by almost all ads I see on those platforms violate one or both of them. #marketing   #advertising   #socialmedia   #socialmediamarketingtips   #videoadvertising   #socialmediamarketing   #facebook   #instagrammarketing   #instagram   #facebookmarketing

What I learned is that college isn’t for everyone, but the  University of Southern California  was the best option for me. People have different paths to success, and each has its own unique pros and cons.
